answers.answer: Dont read too much in pregnancy symptoms being different for the gender. I had hyperemesis, or severe morning sickness, with my son up until I was 15 weeks and got diagnosed with gestational diabetes at 15 weeks. This baby, morning sickness not as bad, still havr it some at 24 weeks and gestational diabetes test came back negative around 15 weeks. Everyone swore I was having a girl since it's so different, but nope, another boy!
Me!! I'm a ftm had morning sickness from 6-18weeks and still now when I eat something my daughter doesn't like!

question: so , i'm going to be a second time mom :) during my first pregnancy , i had horrible 'morning sickness' my entire first trimester . with this pregnancy i barely had any 'morning sickness' my first trimester , & now i'm 17+ 1 & all of a sudden i'm getting constant 'morning sickness' . i had a little boy the first time , so hopefully this means i'm having a little girl . my question(s) , have any of you ever experienced morning sickness in the second trimester ? i'm new here & just curious :)
title: curiouss
